you don't have to be a health expert to talk about the risks of smoking and you shouldn't dwell on the long-term consequences many kids don't care what might happen in 20 to 30 years but they are concerned with how they look and smell now rebellious kids can pose a special challenge since your views on teens and cigarettes could actually prompt them to start smoking there is however an approach that may work well it's called Palms up actually turn your

up and say I don't know what decisions you'll make when you become an adult but right now your teenager and it's really important to me because I love you and I care about you and in spite of all of our differences that's the most important thing in the world to me your health and your safety that you not start smoking and what if your child is already smoking have a similar conversation aimed at getting them to quit make an appointment with your doctor to get some help and impose consequences for breaking the
